overview:
## Discussion

Set this configuration value to cause a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchRequest] to execute a fetch with a new predicate.

Access this value of a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchRequest/Configuration] structure for a given request by using the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchedResults/nsPredicate] property on the associated [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchedResults] instance, either directly or through a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Binding].

# nsPredicate

**Instance Property**

The request’s predicate.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency var nsPredicate: NSPredicate?
```

## Discussion

Set this configuration value to cause a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchRequest] to execute a fetch with a new predicate.

Access this value of a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchRequest/Configuration] structure for a given request by using the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchedResults/nsPredicate] property on the associated [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FetchedResults] instance, either directly or through a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Binding].
title: nsPredicate
